Label: Magnetic field solution (at 1 sample per sec) produced by VEFI on the Communication Navigation Outage Forecast System satellite.  The data are PRELIMINARY, and as such, are intended for BROWSE PURPOSES ONLY. - Robert F. Pfaff (NASA GSFC)

DatasetLink.Title: VEFI Project home page at NASA Goddard Space Flight Center

VariableDescription.Name: B_north
VariableDescription.LongDescription: Magnetic field in the north direction, PRELIMINARY
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         CNOFS
#     SOURCE_NAME                     CNOFS>Communications Navigation Outage Forecast System
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Ionospheric Science
#     DATA_TYPE                       K0>Key Parameter, the data are PRELIMINARY, and as such, are intended for BROWSE                       
#                                      PURPOSES ONLY.                                                                                        
#     DESCRIPTOR                      VEFI
#     FILE_NAMING_CONVENTION          source_datatype_descriptor
#     DATA_VERSION                    05
#     PI_NAME                         Robert F. Pfaff
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  NASA GSFC
#     TEXT                            The DC vector magnetometer on the CNOFS spacecraft is a three axis, fluxgate                           
#     TEXT                             sensor with active thermal control situated on a 0.6m boom.  This magnetometer                        
#     TEXT                             measures the Earth's magnetic field using 16 bit A/D converters at 1 sample                           
#     TEXT                             per sec with a range of .. 45,000 nT.  Its primary objective on the CNOFS spacecraft                  
#     TEXT                             is to enable an accurate V x B measurement along the spacecraft trajectory.                           
#     TEXT                              In order to provide an in-flight calibration of the magnetic field data, we                          
#     TEXT                             compare the most recent POMME model (the POtsdam Magnetic Model of the Earth,                         
#     TEXT                             http://geomag.org/models/pomme5.html) with the actual magnetometer measurements                       
#     TEXT                             to help determine a set of calibration parameters for the gains, offsets, and                         
#     TEXT                             non-orthogonality matrix of the sensor axes.  The calibrated magnetic field                           
#     TEXT                             measurements are provided in the data file here. The VEFI magnetic field data                         
#                                      file currently contains the following variables:                                                      
#                                     B_north   Magnetic field in the north direction
#                                     B_up      Magnetic field in the up direction
#                                     B_west    Magnetic field in the west direction
#                                     
#                                     The data is PRELIMINARY, and as such, is intended for BROWSE PURPOSES ONLY.                            
#                                       Registering your email will allow notification of updates.                                           
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Magnetic Fields (space)
#     MISSION_GROUP                   CNOFS
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  cnofs_vefi_bfield_1sec
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 cnofs_vefi_bfield_1sec_20080509_v05
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Magnetic field solution (at 1 sample per sec) produced by VEFI on the Communication                    
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION       Navigation Outage Forecast System satellite.  The data are PRELIMINARY, and                           
#                                      as such, are intended for BROWSE PURPOSES ONLY.                                                       
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 1 second
#     RULES_OF_USE                    While the VEFI data are still preliminary, users are requested to contact the                          
#                                      P.I., Dr. Robert Pfaff at NASA GSFC, prior to publication of any VEFI data.                           
#     GENERATED_BY                    S. Martin, ADNET Systems Inc. on contract to NASA GSFC
#     GENERATION_DATE                 Mon Jun 22 10:51:41 2009
#     ACKNOWLEDGEMENT                 VEFI was designed and built by NASA Goddard Space Flight Center. CNOFS is a                            
#     ACKNOWLEDGEMENT                  joint effort between the Air Force Research Laboratory Space Vehicles Directorate                     
#                                      and the USAF Space Test Program.                                                                      
#     LINK_TEXT                       Please see our
#     LINK_TITLE                      VEFI Project home page at NASA Goddard Space Flight Center
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://vefi.gsfc.nasa.gov/
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Default time
#  2. Magnetic field in the north direction, PRELIMINARY
#       NOTES:  Spherical coordinate system
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 22:30:35 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#       NOTES:  Spherical coordinate system
#
EPOCH                             B_NORTH
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.mil.mic            nT
09-05-2008 00:00:00.000.000       27866.0

VariableDescription.Name: B_IGRF_north
VariableDescription.LongDescription: IGRF Magnetic field in the north direction, PRELIMINARY
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******

#     DATA_VERSION                    05
#     PI_NAME                         Robert F. Pfaff
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  NASA GSFC
#     TEXT                            The DC vector magnetometer on the CNOFS spacecraft is a three axis, fluxgate                           
#     TEXT                             sensor with active thermal control situated on a 0.6m boom.  This magnetometer                        
#     TEXT                             measures the Earth's magnetic field using 16 bit A/D converters at 1 sample                           
#     TEXT                             per sec with a range of .. 45,000 nT.  Its primary objective on the CNOFS spacecraft                  
#     TEXT                             is to enable an accurate V x B measurement along the spacecraft trajectory.                           
#     TEXT                              In order to provide an in-flight calibration of the magnetic field data, we                          
#     TEXT                             compare the most recent POMME model (the POtsdam Magnetic Model of the Earth,                         
#     TEXT                             http://geomag.org/models/pomme5.html) with the actual magnetometer measurements                       
#     TEXT                             to help determine a set of calibration parameters for the gains, offsets, and                         
#     TEXT                             non-orthogonality matrix of the sensor axes.  The calibrated magnetic field                           
#     TEXT                             measurements are provided in the data file here. The VEFI magnetic field data                         
#                                      file currently contains the following variables:                                                      
#                                     B_north   Magnetic field in the north direction
#                                     B_up      Magnetic field in the up direction
#                                     B_west    Magnetic field in the west direction
#                                     
#                                     The data is PRELIMINARY, and as such, is intended for BROWSE PURPOSES ONLY.                            
#                                       Registering your email will allow notification of updates.                                           
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Magnetic Fields (space)
#     MISSION_GROUP                   CNOFS
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  cnofs_vefi_bfield_1sec
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 cnofs_vefi_bfield_1sec_20080509_v05
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Magnetic field solution (at 1 sample per sec) produced by VEFI on the Communication                    
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION       Navigation Outage Forecast System satellite.  The data are PRELIMINARY, and                           
#                                      as such, are intended for BROWSE PURPOSES ONLY.                                                       
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 1 second

#                                      P.I., Dr. Robert Pfaff at NASA GSFC, prior to publication of any VEFI data.

#              ************************************
#
#  1. Default time
#  2. IGRF Magnetic field in the north direction, PRELIMINARY
#       NOTES:  Geodetic coordinate system, IGRF-11 B field in the north direction with respect to the WGS-84 reference ellipsoid of the earth.
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 22:30:37 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#       NOTES:  Geodetic coordinate system, IGRF-11 B field in the north direction with respect to the WGS-84 reference ellipsoid of the earth.

EPOCH                        B_IGRF_NORTH
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.mil.mic            nT
09-05-2008 00:00:00.000.000       27788.8

VariableDescription.Name: latitude
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         CNOFS
#     SOURCE_NAME                     CNOFS>Communications Navigation Outage Forecast System
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Ionospheric Science
#     DATA_TYPE                       K0>Key Parameter, the data are PRELIMINARY, and as such, are intended for BROWSE                       
#                                      PURPOSES ONLY.                                                                                        
#     DESCRIPTOR                      VEFI
#     FILE_NAMING_CONVENTION          source_datatype_descriptor
#     DATA_VERSION                    05
#     PI_NAME                         Robert F. Pfaff
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  NASA GSFC
#     TEXT                            The DC vector magnetometer on the CNOFS spacecraft is a three axis, fluxgate                           
#     TEXT                             sensor with active thermal control situated on a 0.6m boom.  This magnetometer                        
#     TEXT                             measures the Earth's magnetic field using 16 bit A/D converters at 1 sample                           
#     TEXT                             per sec with a range of .. 45,000 nT.  Its primary objective on the CNOFS spacecraft                  
#     TEXT                             is to enable an accurate V x B measurement along the spacecraft trajectory.                           
#     TEXT                              In order to provide an in-flight calibration of the magnetic field data, we                          
#     TEXT                             compare the most recent POMME model (the POtsdam Magnetic Model of the Earth,                         
#     TEXT                             http://geomag.org/models/pomme5.html) with the actual magnetometer measurements                       
#     TEXT                             to help determine a set of calibration parameters for the gains, offsets, and                         
#     TEXT                             non-orthogonality matrix of the sensor axes.  The calibrated magnetic field                           
#     TEXT                             measurements are provided in the data file here. The VEFI magnetic field data                         
#                                      file currently contains the following variables:                                                      
#                                     B_north   Magnetic field in the north direction
#                                     B_up      Magnetic field in the up direction
#                                     B_west    Magnetic field in the west direction
#                                     
#                                     The data is PRELIMINARY, and as such, is intended for BROWSE PURPOSES ONLY.                            
#                                       Registering your email will allow notification of updates.                                           
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Magnetic Fields (space)
#     MISSION_GROUP                   CNOFS
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  cnofs_vefi_bfield_1sec
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 cnofs_vefi_bfield_1sec_20080509_v05
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Magnetic field solution (at 1 sample per sec) produced by VEFI on the Communication                    
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION       Navigation Outage Forecast System satellite.  The data are PRELIMINARY, and                           
#                                      as such, are intended for BROWSE PURPOSES ONLY.                                                       
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 1 second
#     RULES_OF_USE                    While the VEFI data are still preliminary, users are requested to contact the                          
#                                      P.I., Dr. Robert Pfaff at NASA GSFC, prior to publication of any VEFI data.                           
#     GENERATED_BY                    S. Martin, ADNET Systems Inc. on contract to NASA GSFC
#     GENERATION_DATE                 Mon Jun 22 10:51:41 2009
#     ACKNOWLEDGEMENT                 VEFI was designed and built by NASA Goddard Space Flight Center. CNOFS is a                            
#     ACKNOWLEDGEMENT                  joint effort between the Air Force Research Laboratory Space Vehicles Directorate                     
#                                      and the USAF Space Test Program.                                                                      
#     LINK_TEXT                       Please see our
#     LINK_TITLE                      VEFI Project home page at NASA Goddard Space Flight Center
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://vefi.gsfc.nasa.gov/
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Default time
#  2. Latitude of the spacecraft
#       NOTES:  Geodetic latitude with respect to the WGS-84 earth model.
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 22:30:38 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#       NOTES:  Geodetic latitude with respect to the WGS-84 earth model.
#
EPOCH                            LATITUDE
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.mil.mic       degrees
09-05-2008 00:00:00.000.000      -9.76186
